sub_title: Associate Professor of Hydrology & Water Resources
summary:
Dr. Jochen Wenninger, Associate Professor of Hydrology & Water Resources at IHE Delft since 2018, is a hydrology expert with more than 10 years of experience in research, education, and capacity building. From 2008 to 2017 he was Lecturer / Senior Lecturer at the Core of Hydrology and Water Resources, after working several years with the Institute of Hydrology at Freiburg University in Germany. 
His educational background is in earth- and geo-sciences with a focus on hydrology and he received his degree in 2002 from Freiburg University, Germany and a doctorate in 2007 from the same University. From professional practice as hydrologist, he developed a thorough understanding of the relationships between physical, technical as well as socio-economic components of the water cycle. 
As a researcher he focuses on hydrological process knowledge and modelling of water fluxes at varying spatial and temporal scales, focussing on experimental catchment hydrology and the use of tracers and stable water isotopes. He was involved in interdisciplinary research and project work in Kenya, Tanzania, Ethiopia, Sudan, Rwanda, Swaziland, South Africa, Palestine, China, Philippines, Austria, and Germany. Project and capacity building activities concern project administration, water resources assessment and water resources planning within an integrated perspective. He is involved in supervision of MSc and PhD researchers and has published more than 40 articles in peer reviewed journals.
He is a member of the American Geophysical Union (AGU), the International Association of Hydrological Sciences (IAHS), the European Geosciences Union (EGU) and the SENSE Research School, and regularly peer reviews articles for journals including Hydrology and Earth System Sciences, Agricultural Water Management, Journal of Hydrology, and Hydrological Sciences Journal.

projects:
[{'title': 'MaMaSe', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The MaMaSe Sustainable Water Initiative is aimed at improving water safety and security in the Mara River Basin (MRB) to support structural poverty reduction, sustainable economic growth, and conservation of the basin’s world-renowned ecosystems. We will pursue this through a broad-based, basin-scale public-private-partnership (PPP) designed to empower people and promote self-reliance. We will address all five solutions specified in the application requirements, working in all of the basin’s landscapes and focusing on improved water management in the main economic activities of the basin: agriculture, cattle ranching, and wildlife-based tourism. A single, well-coordinated initiative will enable the basin-scale interconnection of knowledge, policies, institutions, markets, and good practices that is required for structural poverty reduction, sustainable economic growth, and ecosystem conservation. It will also provide a platform for the engagement of new partners (Kenyan and international) and a systematic expansion of activities that further benefit the basin and its people.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jochen', 'last_name': 'Wenninger', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Associate Professor of Hydrology & Water Resources'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Paolo', 'last_name': 'Paron', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Land and Water Advisor at FAO Somalia and Senior Lecturer in Earth Science and Remote Sensing at IHE Delft Institute for Water Education'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Hans', 'last_name': 'van der Kwast', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Associate Professor of Open Science & Digital Innovation / Owner QWAST-GIS'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Victor Langenberg', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Satellite based water monitoring and flow forecasting system in the Niger River Basin (FCST Niger)', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Location: Niger

Activities performed:  Collection and processing of spatial and temporal data for the satellite based hydrological model, Workshops and staff training, Project reporting', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jochen', 'last_name': 'Wenninger', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Associate Professor of Hydrology & Water Resources'}]}, {'title': 'Capacity Building for Integrated Water Resources Management in South Africa (NICHE/ZAF/016 and 062)', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Location:  South Africa
